q: The star, who has had two miscarriages, told Piers Morgan she wanted him to give the money to a stillbirth and neo-natal death charity that supports bereaved parents. Writing on Twitter, she said: i'd do it for a million for SANDS. money, mouth?????????????????? Piers Morgan , whose guests on the ITV1 interview show have included Gordon Brown , Cheryl Cole and Simon Cowell , told Lily Allen :`` I will get ITV to make substantial five-figure donation to your charity for the interview''.

In 2010, the group chaired by Fiat chief Sergio Marchionne completed the acquisition of 10 firms for 302 million Swiss francs. SGS said they helped generated an additional 142 million Swiss francs in revenues. SGS is expecting to show improvements in top line growth compared to 2010, the group added, while continuing to target`` substantial investment'' in development projects. The company's board recommended a dividend payment of 65 francs per share.

CEO Sergio Marchionne said last month that Chrysler expects to sell 2 million vehicles globally in 2011. They're looking at selling 1.5 million to 1.6 million vehicles in the U.S., said Bill Kelly, owner of Kelly Cars in Moon Township, Pa., near Pittsburgh.`` And it's going to be less dependent on fleet sales.'' With her closest friends from Congress holding her hand Wednesday evening, Gabrielle Giffords opened her unbandaged left eye and tried to focus on loved ones for the first time. This is a major leap forward. This is a major milestone for her and we're hoping that she crosses through many more, said her neurosurgeon Dr. Peter Michael Lemole. Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand , who was present for the eye opening, said:`` It was raw courage. It was raw strength. It was so beautiful and so moving.''

Google Inc. , the search engine with almost two-thirds of the U.S. market, is making acquisitions every couple of weeks- more than the once-a-month pace Eric Schmidt projected when it began buying companies again last year after the

, he suggested. Technology could help. With Google's vast power for capturing and remembering data, Eric Schmidt painted a picture in which technology could help quantify and verify the assertions made in policy documents. Government is highly measurable, most of it, he said.`` We can actually see how many people got this shot or read this report or so forth. A government-- a transparent government-- should be able to[ measure] that.''
